newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean Red Cross to send $1 mln food aid to North.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean Red Cross to send $1 mln food aid to North.

text.p: South Korea's Red Cross will send more than $1 million worth of food and vegetable seed to flood-stricken North Korea on Thursday, the second aid shipment in a week, a Red Cross spokesman said on Tuesday.
It will be the largest food delivery by the South Korean National Red Cross to the impoverished North since such shipments began in November 1995, he added.

The latest relief comprises 1,650 tonnes of potatoes, 10 tonnes of powdered milk and 11.2 tonnes of turnip and cabbage seeds, a Red Cross statement said. The total value was one billion won ($1.12 million).
On Monday the Seoul government lifted a ban on private organisations providing rice to Pyongyang and allowed local business groups to join food aid programmes for the North.
"We will soon be able to begin shipping rice to North Korea," Red Cross spokesman Lee Jong-geun said.

Previously, only local religious and human rights groups and individual South Koreans could ship non-rice food aid to the North. Seoul had banned shipments of rice over fears it could be diverted to the military.
